comment: Loved her! I'm a theatre major and I had her for Intro to Theatre Studies and she was wonderful! Very tough grader, but she's extremely fair and gives great feedback that will help you grow. She's extremely passionate about her field and her students and she is very knowledgable about everything she teaches throughout the class.

BRILLIANT! Extremely passionate which makes it easy to  want to work. Lots of plays to read, but the quizzes for them are online so you can brainstorm with others in your class. Grades harshly, but not to the point of unfairness. They're always great comments that you can learn from. Great clothes. Love her but you have to work for the grade.

I took her Intro to Performance Studies class and I am indeed a theater major.  I love Professor Robinson. She's funny, animated, and passionate about her subject. She does grade papers fairly harshly but if you follow the outlined directions she gives you, you're fine. I had a blast in her class this semester.
a unique style of teaching. She creates interesting class discussions, and values everyone's opinion. A true theatre teacher. She does grade the papers harshly however.

She is a little crazy, but she is fun. Also she is very helpful as long as you go to her with questions. I enjoyed this class; the Group project was very fun. She does not have a normal teaching style. Go to class and take notes, quizzes are from the notes. She grades papers pretty hard so be careful. But she is not so bad - I liked her!
No Comments
THE BAIN OF MY EXISTANCE at the KSU theatre department!  She is unclear and so scattered it is frustrating to even talk to her!
I took her in for two classes in the Treatre Dept.  She has no idea how to teach either of them.  Her brain is so scattered it is extremly hard to take notes.  All I can say is GOOD LUCK!
Scatter-brained but nice.  The class isn't as bad as some on here make it out to be, but can be boring.  Just do your work and you'll be fine.

Class isn't hard, but hardly worth all the effort.  Attending all of the out of class functions can be very difficult if you have any life at all.  I don't recommend it unless you just can't bear to take one of the fine arts classes.
she is FAKE nice, but is kinda mean. class is easy, the play reports are ridiculously hard. be ready to write very indepth reports. class is a breeze, very boring though
very nice

Just when you think you might be taking an interesting class, this bore-fest appears. Now, mind you, it's probably better than the other Fine Arts classes, but it takes literally no effort, sometime the teachers also seemed to show. A waste of time.

this class was so easy. it wasnt bad at all. the class was so big that it didnt matter if you were there. all the notes are posted online, but class was a breeze if you do go. be descriptive in your reports and you will get an A.

She is not as bad as everyone says.  The class is big, and boring, but it isn't that bad.  You have to write reports for the performances you go see, which takes time, but it isn't too bad.  Don't expect an A if you don't do the work, she will fail you.
awful
HER CLASS IS TOTAL BORING. I WAS A HUGE THEATRE FREAK UNTIL I HAD TO TAKE HER CLASS. I WOULD RECOMMEDND MING,OR ANY ONE ELES OVER HER

this class is terrible.  the class is very boring so i stopped attending it.  It is pointless but easy.   I have never had to spend so much money in a class.  You have to attend many theatre performances, an art exhibit, and a musical performance.
Hardly ever attended class b/c it was so boring and still made an A
I would never attend one of her classes again unless it were mandated. Period.
This class is ridiculously boring.
Class was so freakin' boring, though I must admit it was quite easy.
She is moody and if it weren't for the other profs her class would be unbearable
